channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Public footpath sign on corner of Park Lane & Spring Lane has rusted through and is falling over, could possibly fall on somebody., 29th March
item.description:
On corner of Park Lane and Spring Lane. Outside of Skylarks, Park Lane. Signpost pillar has rusted at the bottom and is now falling over, currently leaning on Skyarkâ€™s fence and potentially damaging the property and risk of injury to people.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Spring Lane, Prestbury, Cheltenham

item.title: A street light on Shurdington Road is not working, 29th March
item.description:

item.title: Blocked drain on crossroads, big puddle, 29th March
item.description:
The crossroads of Kipling Road and Shelley Road has a blocked drain that floods the road and the pavement after rain. The drain is visibly blocked with dirt. This has been a recurring issue at this spot.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Shelley Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Significant failure in road, 29th March
item.description:
The entirety of Reddings Road from the roundabout at Hatherley Lane all the way to Grovefield Way is disintegrating. There are a significant number of potholes, the road is giving way in places and it's becoming almost undriveable. The vibrations from heavy buses hitting the splits in the road is causing significant vibrations into my property and cracks are appearing. The entire road needs completely replacing
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Reddings Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot holes, 29th March
item.description:
There's still a number of pot holes in Hartley lane some of them was was done about a week ago and even them are starting to fail already it's becoming a joke that we can't drive out of our homes with out the risk of damage to my vehicle all ready damaged a wheel/tire now the shocks are gone Hartley lane needs resurfacing filling in pot holes isn't doing anything
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartley Lane, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: From Sudeley Cottages all the way upto Sudeley entrance there are blocked drains and culverts, 29th March
item.description:
From the Winchcombe town sign all the way up to the castle there are a number of blocked drains and culverts. I notified you last year and the year before but nothing was done and yet again we faced another flood Thursday morning. If it helps I can take photos of every blocked drain and culvert.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Brockhampton Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A large pothole hidden from view between two painted white lines, 29th March
item.description:
At a junction with the twelve bells pub on the right. The hole is caught between the white lines for the junction so is not easy to see. Lots of cars are having problems there- we have seen 6 cars with blown out tyres pulled up at a nearby lay-by and garage just whilst trying to sort our car!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large deep potholes in carriageway in direction Southam to Woodmancote, 29th March
item.description:
Approx 50m before turning into Two Hedges Road. Very difficult to avoid with oncoming traffic. Potholes are not marked and have filled with rainwater.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury

item.title: Glebe road number 22 prestbury, 29th March
item.description:
This issues has been ongoing for years but this issue is 4 days old and we cannot get out the drive to go to my wifeâ€™s disabled dad plus we cannot see our disabled daughter who lives in Cleeve Our neighbours at 21 Glebe road have a new born baby and canâ€™t get out there drive The last time we reported this we never had any response Letâ€™s hope we do this time

item.title: Pipe under road blocked - water building back and overflowing ditch Re:- 11453928, 29th March
item.description:
Ref:- 11453928 - Highways Job number reported on 28th March 2024. Attempts ahve been made to get an update but nothing at all from Highways. Water - possibly contaminated is flowing down from Ham Hill and via a normally dry ditch. However, due to work up Ham Hill, a lot of silt and hedge cuttings have been washed down. A narrow pipe at the end of an underground culvert became fully blocked and water overflowed and running down the lane. One house has been flooded before on a previous event and luckily not a lot of water entered the property. Please can this be cleared as quickl;y as possible as subsequent rain has increased the flow of water. An update from Highways would be appreciated!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ham Lane, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
